title: Zak Hardaker shock inclusion in 24-man Great Britain squad for tour of New Zealand and Papua New Guinea
text:
Reformed character Zak Hardaker will aim to continue his rehabilitation in a Great Britain jersey after being the shock inclusion in a 24-man squad for the forthcoming tour of New Zealand and Papua New Guinea.

The Wigan Warriors full-back last won international honours two-and-a-half years ago, having since served a 14-month ban from rugby league after testing positive for cocaine.

The 27-year-old Yorkshireman was subsequently sacked by Castleford Tigers and joined Wigan but was banned from driving last October after admitting being more than twice the drink-drive limit.

That came before Hardaker had even made an appearance for the Warriors but he entered the Sporting Chance clinic and vowed to turn his life around.

His consistent form this year, helping Wigan into the play-off semi-finals where they lost to Salford earlier this month, has attracted the attention of Great Britain coach Wayne Bennett.
